source.description: The source of diagnostics, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'. Optional.

DiagnosticResult.title: Diagnostic Result
DiagnosticResult.description: Result of diagnostic tool such as a compiler or a linter. It's intended to be used as top-level structured format which represents a whole result of a diagnostic tool.

url.description: A URL to open with more information about this rule code. Optional.

location.description: Location at which this diagnostic message applies.

source.description: The source of this diagnostic, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'. Optional.

suggestions.description: Suggested fixes to resolve this diagnostic. Optional.

original_output.description: Experimental: If this diagnostic is converted from other formats, original_output represents the original output which corresponds to this diagnostic. Optional.

reviewdog.rdf.Diagnostic.title: Diagnostic
reviewdog.rdf.Diagnostic.description: Represents a diagnostic, such as a compiler error or warning. It's intended to be used as structured format which represents a diagnostic and can be used as stream of input/output such as jsonl. This message should be self-contained to report a diagnostic.

path.description: File path. It could be either absolute path or relative path.

range.description: Range in the file path. Optional.

column.description: Column number, starting at 1 (byte count in UTF-8). Example: 'aêêÄb'  The column of a: 1  The column of êêÄ: 2  The column of b: 6 since êêÄ is represented with 4 bytes in UTF-8. Optional.

end.description: end can be omitted. Then the range is handled as zero-length (start == end). Optional.

reviewdog.rdf.Range.title:
The end position is *exclusive*. It might be a bit unnatural for you or for
 some diagnostic tools to use exclusive range, but it's necessary to represent
 zero-width range especially when using it in Suggestion context to support
 code insertion.
 Example: "14" in "haya14busa"
   start: { line: 1, column: 5 }
   end:   { line: 1, column: 7 } # <= Exclusive

 |h|a|y|a|1|4|b|u|s|a|
 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 1
         ^---^
 haya14busa
     ^^

 If you want to specify a range that
 contains a line including the line ending character(s), then use an end
 position denoting the start of the next line.
 Example:
   start: { line: 5, column: 23 }
   end:   { line: 6, column: 1 }

 If both start and end position omit column value, it's
 handled as linewise and the range includes end position (line) as well.
 Example:
   start: { line: 5 }
   end:   { line: 6 }
 The above example represents range start from line 5 to the end of line 6
 including EOL.

 Examples for line range:
  Text example. <line>|<line content>(line breaking)
  1|abc\r\n
  2|def\r\n
  3|ghi\r\n

 start: { line: 2 }
   => "abc"

 start: { line: 2 }
 end:   { line: 2 }
   => "abc"

 start: { line: 2 }
 end:   { line: 3 }
   => "abc\r\ndef"

 start: { line: 2 }
 end:   { line: 3, column: 1 }
   => "abc\r\n"
reviewdog.rdf.Range.description:
A range in a text document expressed as start and end positions.  The end position is *exclusive*. It might be a bit unnatural for you or for some diagnostic tools to use exclusive range, but it's necessary to represent zero-width range especially when using it in Suggestion context to support code insertion. Example: "14" in "haya14busa"   start: { line: 1, column: 5 }   end:   { line: 1, column: 7 } # <= Exclusive |h|a|y|a|1|4|b|u|s|a| 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 1         ^---^ haya14busa     ^^ If you want to specify a range that contains a line including the line ending character(s), then use an end position denoting the start of the next line. Example:   start: { line: 5, column: 23 }   end:   { line: 6, column: 1 } If both start and end position omit column value, it's handled as linewise and the range includes end position (line) as well. Example:   start: { line: 5 }   end:   { line: 6 } The above example represents range start from line 5 to the end of line 6 including EOL. Examples for line range:  Text example. <line>|<line content>(line breaking)  1|abc
  2|def
  3|ghi
 start: { line: 2 }   => "abc" start: { line: 2 } end:   { line: 2 }   => "abc" start: { line: 2 } end:   { line: 3 }   => "abc
def" start: { line: 2 } end:   { line: 3, column: 1 }   => "abc
"  start: { line: 2, column: 1 } end:   { line: 2, column: 4 }   => "abc" (without line-break)

name.description: A human-readable string describing the source of diagnostics, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'.

range.description: Range at which this suggestion applies. To insert text into a document create a range where start == end.

text.description: A suggested text which replace the range. For delete operations use an empty string.

reviewdog.rdf.Suggestion.title: Suggestion
reviewdog.rdf.Suggestion.description: Suggestion represents a suggested text manipulation to resolve a diagnostic problem. Insert example ('hayabusa' -> 'haya15busa'):   range {     start {       line: 1       column: 5     }     end {       line: 1       column: 5     }   }   text: 15 |h|a|y|a|b|u|s|a| 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9         ^--- insert '15' Update example ('haya15busa' -> 'haya14busa'):   range {     start {       line: 1       column: 5     }     end {       line: 1       column: 7     }   }   text: 14 |h|a|y|a|1|5|b|u|s|a| 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 1         ^---^ replace with '14'
